thread.title: Man pleads not guilty over leaving child in car during Brisbane heatwave - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Man pleads not guilty over leaving child in car during Brisbane heatwave - Yahoo7

author: News On February
title: Man pleads not guilty over leaving child in car during Brisbane heatwave - Yahoo7
text:
Share Man pleads not guilty over leaving child in car during Brisbane heatwave - Yahoo7 A Brisbane man accused of leaving a four-year-old boy in a car during Sundayâ€™s heatwave has faced court. Close Man pleads not guilty to leaving boy in hot car UP NEXT VIDEO A man accused of leaving a four-year-old boy in a car at a shopping centre during a heatwave has faced court. Source: 7 News Man pleads not guilty to leaving boy in hot car 
The 39-year-old Fortitude Valley man pleaded not guilty and will be back in court next week. 
Police allege the man left the child in the car with the windows rolled down while he went to the shops. Self-serve checkout scam nets mum thousands in groceries 
The young boy, who was rescued after a passerby noticed him asleep in the car, was unharmed. 
Police were called to the underground car park at the shopping centre on Methyr Rd at New Farm about 1.30pm on Sunday. The man pleaded not guilty when he appeared in court on Tuesday 
The boy was placed in a police van to cool down in its air conditioning, before being taken to Brisbane's Lady Cilento Hospital.
